member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectProvider
member.summary: Visual Studio designer component that provides persistent objects.

remarks.para: The ObjectProvider class and the class are the major components to bind persistent objects to data bound controls like the .

The ObjectProvider component is used to determine the objects by specifying the selection criteria. The ObjectView component is used to bind the provided objects to data bound controls and GUI elements.

Dragging the ObjectProvider component from the Telerik.OpenAccess .NET Toolbox to a Designer window will trigger the initialization dialog. After completing the dialog, all properties can be set using the Visual Studio properties window.

The ObjectProvider component is also used during creation of a Telerik.OpenAccess .NET Data Form using the 'Data Form Wizard'. For details about Telerik.OpenAccess .NET Wizards, refer to the 'Visual Studio Integration' documentation.
Instances of this class are for example used at the ObjectView.ObjectProvider property.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectProvider.components
member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectProvider.masterOP
member.summary: in case of sharing the objectscope, the one who is responsible for the transaction

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectProvider.SaveAll
member.summary: Saves all changes in general into the database.
member.remarks: This method checkpoints the transaction. If the transaction is not nested the changes will made public in the database. Will do nothing if no context is set.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectProvider.CancelAll
member.summary: Reverts the changes since the last SaveAll.
member.remarks: Will do nothing if no context is set.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectProvider.Refresh
member.summary: Recalculates the result.
member.remarks: Recalculates the result so that changes made by other transactions will be visible.

service.

member.summary: Event handler for the Refreshed event triggered by a Refresh() method call.
member.remarks: When not null, the event handler is called after the list has been refreshed.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectProvider.ObjectContext
member.summary: Controls the used IObjectContext instance

remarks.para:
Getsthe used IObjectContext. If no context is set, it will be requested from the ObjectContextProvider as described by the
and the properties. If is true, the transaction of the context will be started.
Sets an instance of and starts the transaction of the context if is true.

member.value: The IObjectContext used by this ObjectProvider instance.

member.summary: Controls the type name of a class that implements the IObjectContextProvider interface
member.remarks: An ObjectContextProvider class might be generated by the Visual Studio Integration Wizards.
member.value: The type name

member.summary: Obsolete
member.value: Obsolete
member.remarks: Obsolete

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectProvider.UsePrivateObjectContext
member.summary: Controls if a private or sharable IObjectContext will be get from the ObjectContextProvider as specified in 'ObjectContextProviderTypeName'.
member.remarks: Sharing a context means that the same physical objects are used and changes are immediately visible
member.value: true changes are not visible by other until they are saved. false changes are visible by other that uses the same IObjectContext.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectProvider.BaseType
member.summary: Controls the type of the persistent objects in the result.
member.remarks:
All objects delivered by this instance will be of the given type or of a derived type.
The specified type must be attributed with [Persistent] and must have been enhanced.
member.value: The base type; must be [Persistent].

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectProvider.ResultMethod
member.summary: Controls how the ObjectProvider gets the result.

remarks.para: There are various ways an ObjectProvider might get the set of objects, that he provides (the 'ObjectSource').
In case of Manual, the ObjectSource is explicitely set.
In case of Query, the ObjectSource is set by executing a Query, specified by the .
In case of Request, an ObjectContainer will be filled by calling RequestName.

member.value: A ResultMethodType value.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectProvider.OQLStatement
member.summary: Controls the OQL select statement used to filter/query the objects.
member.remarks: Will be used if the is ResultMethodType.Query
member.value: The OQL query string

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectProvider.RequestName
member.summary: Controls the name of a webmethod that provide container data.
member.remarks: Will be used if the is ResultMethodType.Request
member.value: The full name of the webmethod

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectProvider.ResultName
member.summary: Controls the name for the result to identify it.
member.remarks: The name can useful when using an .
member.value: Name of the result set.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectProvider.FetchGroup
member.summary: Controls which fetch group will be used while getting the result or filling the ObjectContainer.
member.value: Name of the fetch group.
member.remarks: Null is an allowed value.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectProvider.PrefetchValue
member.summary: Controls the number of objects that should be prefetched.
member.remarks: This value might be used to optimize the fetching of objects.
member.value: The number of objects to be prefetched; default is 30.

member.value: An object of a persistent capable class or an IEnumerable/IEnumerator containing these objects.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView
member.summary: A Visual Studio Designer component that allows binding of persistent objects to data bound controls.

remarks.para: The ObjectView class and the class are the major components to bind 'persistent objects' to data bound controls like the .

The ObjectView component is used to bind persistent objects to data bound controls and GUI elements, the ObjectProvider component can be used to determine the objects by specifying the selection criteria.

Dragging the ObjectView component from the Telerik.OpenAccess .NET Toolbox to a Designer window will trigger the initialization dialog. After completing the dialog, all properties can be set using the Visual Studio properties window.

The ObjectView component is also used during creation of a Telerik.OpenAccess .NET Data Form using the 'Data Form Wizard'. For details about Telerik.OpenAccess .NET Wizards, refer to the 'Visual Studio Integration' documentation.

There are three ways to specify the persistent objects that should be bound to the GUI:
An ObjectProvider instance is bound to the Property
A persistent object or an enumeration of persistent objects is passed to the ObjectView using the method.
A persistent object or an enumeration of persistent objects (like a query result) is passed to the ObjectView using the DataSource (.Net2 only) property.

The ObjectView handles single references to other persistent types as collections with 0 or 1 allowed entry. You can use this behavior in a master detail view to allow the detail grid to add exactly one new object to the reference or remove it. To switch back to the normal behavior you have to specify on the reference property.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new view without specifying a collection. This constructor is used by the Visual Studio .NET designer when dragging the ObjectView as component to a Windows Form.
member.remarks: Before being useful, the RootType must be set and the collection must be specified with DataSource. The RootType can be specified using the PropertyView in the designer whereas the DataSource must be specified in source code.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.IContainer)
member.summary: Constructs a new view without specifying a collection. This constructor is used by the Visual Studio .NET designer when dragging the ObjectView as component to a Windows Form.
member.remarks: Before being useful, the RootType must be set and the collection must be specified with DataSource. The RootType can be specified using the PropertyView in the designer whereas the DataSource must be specified in source code.
member.param: The container to use.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.#ctor(Telerik.OpenAccess.IObjectContext,System.Collections.IList,System.Type)
member.summary: Constructs a new view for the passed list, for example an IQueryResult.
member.remarks: Constructs a new instance.
member.param: IObjectContext to use.
Any list with 'persistent objects'.
Base type of the objects in the list.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.#ctor(Telerik.OpenAccess.IObjectContext,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Type)
member.summary: Constructs a new view for the objects contained in the IEnumerable.

remarks.para: All elements are copied from the IEnumerable into a list.

member.param: IObjectContext to use.
The IEnumerable that contains the objects to be viewed.
The Type that should be assumed for the objects to be viewed.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.#ctor(Telerik.OpenAccess.IObjectContext,System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Constructs a new view for the passed persistent object.
member.remarks: Constructs a new instance.
member.param: IObjectContext to use for add/remove.
The object to be viewed.
Base type of the objects in the list.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Cleans up any resources being used.
member.remarks: See for more information.
member.param: Transactions might be rolled back if true is passed.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.GetRootType
member.summary: Gets the name of the RootType.
member.remarks: Using this method the name of the root type of this ObjectView can be retrieved.

member.summary: Sets the RootType.
member.remarks: Using this method the root type of the ObjectView can be altered by using the types full name.
member.param: The System.Type.FullName of the persistent root type.

member.summary: Set a collection of objects to be viewed.
member.remarks: The ObjectView can be used over objects provided programatically using this method or by specifying an .
member.param: If not null, Add/Remove will also add/remove the object from the context.
Any list with objects of type 'RootType' or derived.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.SetObjectSource(Telerik.OpenAccess.IObjectContext,System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Set a collection of objects to be viewed. Constructs a new view for the objects contained in the IEnumerable.
member.remarks:
The ObjectView can be used over objects provided programatically using this method or by specifying an .
All elements are copied from the IEnumerable into a list.
member.param: If not null, Add/Remove will also add/remove the object from the context.
The IEnumerable that contains the objects to be viewed.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.SetObjectSource(Telerik.OpenAccess.IObjectContext,System.Object)
member.summary: Set an object or collection of objects to be viewed. Constructs a new view for the passed list, for example an IQueryResult.
member.remarks: The ObjectView can be used over objects provided programatically using this method or by specifying an .
member.param: If not null, Add/Remove will also add/remove the object from the context.
The object to be viewed of type 'RootType' or derived.

member.summary: Returns the PropertyDescriptorCollection that represents the properties on each item used to bind data.
member.param: An array of System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor objects to find in the collection as bindable. This can be null .
member.returns: The System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection that represents the properties on each item used to bind data.
member.remarks: This method uses database schema information.

member.summary: Returns the name of the list.
member.param: An array of System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor objects, the list name for which is returned. This can be null .
member.remarks: The name is composed by concatenating the names of the properties.

member.summary: Removes the persistent object at the specified position.
member.param: Zero-based position.
member.remarks: Modifying the ObjectView might cause changes to the used database.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts the persistent object at the specified position.
member.param: Zero-based position.
The object to be inserted.
member.remarks: Modifying the ObjectView might cause changes to the used database. Depending on the PersistenceBehavior, the object will be marked for adding to the context.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.Remove(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes the persistent object from the ObjectView.
member.param: The object to be removed.
member.remarks: Modifying the ObjectView might cause changes to the used database. Depending on the PersistenceBehavior, the object will be marked for deletion from the context.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.Contains(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified object is contained in this ObjectView.
member.param: The object to find.
member.returns: true if object was found, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Modifying the ObjectView might cause changes to the used database.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.Clear
member.summary: Clears the ObjectView, removing all persistent objects from the list.
member.remarks: Does not remove the objects from the context.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.IndexOf(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the numerical position of a persistent object within the ObjectView.
member.param: The object to find.
member.remarks: The position returned does not correspond with the position in the underlying database/container.

member.summary: Adds an object of a persistence-capable class to the ObjectView.
member.param: The object to add.
member.returns: The numerical position of the added object in this ObjectView (zero-based).
member.remarks: Modifying the ObjectView might cause changes to the used database. Depending on the PersistenceBehavior, the object will be marked for adding to the context.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the persistent objects of this ObjectView to a one-dimensional Array instance at the specified index.
member.remarks: Copies the objects of this ObjectView to an Array, starting at a particular Array index.
member.param: The target array.
The zero-based index in at which the copy operation begins.

member.summary: Return an enumerator for the ObjectView.
member.remarks: Enumerators just allow reading the elements from the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.

member.summary: Adds a new item to the list.
member.remarks: The created instance will be of the base type as specified in the constructor.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.RootType
member.summary: Controls the root type of this ObjectView.
member.remarks: The root type is the type of the objects that are visible directly from this ObjectView.
member.value: The root type of the objects in this view.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.DataSource
member.summary: Sets the data source that the ObjectView binds to.
member.remarks:
You can use the setter to bind a single persistence capable object or a list of persistent objects (or an enumerable of such objects) to the ObjectView. If possible, the ObjectView will infer the object context from the passed instance (when using the result of a query or a single persistent object).
The getter will return null.
member.value: A single persistent object or a query result or a list of objects or objects retrieved from an ObjectProvider or an enumerable.

member.summary: hidden

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.Sort
member.summary: hidden
member.value: The sort property of the ObjectView

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.ObjectProvider
member.summary: Controls the ObjectProvider that delivers the objects to be viewed.
member.remarks: The ObjectView exposes the objects an ObjectProvider can deliver upon request.
member.value: The currently used provider for persistent objects.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.AllowUpdates
member.summary: Controls if a control like a grid will allow editing of cells.
member.remarks: Does not prevent modifying of the objects but influences the IBindingList.AllowEdit property that will be queried from controls.
member.value: true when updates are allowed.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.PersistenceBehavior
member.summary: Controls if new objects will also be marked for adding to the context or marked for deletion from the context.
member.remarks: The default is to mark for add and for delete.
member.value: Context action controlling value.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.AllowListChanges
member.summary: Controls if a control like a grid will allow add/remove of rows.
member.remarks: Does not prevent add/remove of objects but influences the IBindingList.AllowNew and IBindingList.AllowRemove property that will be queried from controls.
member.value: true when list changes are allowed.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets whether this ObjectView is read-only.
member.value: true if permitted access is read-only.
member.remarks: Modifying the ObjectView might cause changes to the used .

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the object associated at the specified position.
member.value: Object at position
member.param: The numerical position (zero-based).
member.remarks: Modifying the ObjectView might cause changes to the used .

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.IsFixedSize
member.summary: Indicates whether the ObjectView has a fixed size.
member.value: true if the object view is of fixed size.
member.remarks: Beeing of fixed size does not imply read-only access.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.IsSynchronized
member.summary: Indicates whether access to the ObjectView is synchronized (thread-safe).
member.value: true if access is thread-safe, usually false.
member.remarks: Per default, access to the ObjectView is not synchronized.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of objects in this ObjectView.
member.value: Number of objects in this object view.
member.remarks: This property will reflect the number of objects in the underlying list.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.SyncRoot
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access.
member.value: An object that can be used to synchronize access this collection.
member.remarks: An ObjectView does not synchronize accessing threads.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.AllowEdit
member.summary: Indicates whether modifications are allowed.
member.remarks: Indicates whether you can update items. It is true, if IsReadOnly is false and AllowUpdates is true.
member.value: Modification is allowed.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.AllowNew
member.summary: Indicates whether you can add items.
member.value: True, if new items can be added
member.remarks: Is true, if AllowRemove is true and AllowUpdates is true and RootType is not abstract.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.AllowRemove
member.summary: Indicates whether you can remove items.
member.value: True, if items can be removed
member.remarks: Is true, if not IsReadOnly and not IsFixedSize and AllowListChanges is true.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.SupportsChangeNotification
member.summary: Indicates whether a ListChanged event is raised when the list changes or an item in the list changes; is always true.
member.value: True

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.SupportsSearching
member.summary: Indicates whether the list supports searching; is always false.
member.value: False

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.SupportsSorting
member.summary: Indicates whether the items are sorted; is always false.
member.value: False

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.IsSorted
member.summary: This property is not supported.
member.value: true if System.ComponentModel.IBindingList.ApplySort(System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor,System.ComponentModel.ListSortDirection) has been called and System.ComponentModel.IBindingList.RemoveSort() has not been called; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.SortDirection
member.summary: This property is not supported.
member.value: Specifies the direction of a sort operation.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.SortProperty
member.summary: This property is not supported.
member.value: The sort property of the ObjectView

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.TxnAllowsModification
member.summary: Gets the currency manager instance.
member.remarks: Please see here for more information about the CurrencyManager type.
member.value: The associated currency manager instance.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.Modifiable
member.summary: Indicates whether the underlying context allows modification or not.
member.remarks: The used by the ObjectView is checked for an active transaction.
member.value: true if the ObjectView allows modifications.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.GenerateIEditableObjectWrapperForNewObjects
member.summary: Indicates whether the EditableObject wrapper will be generated or not.
member.remarks: If set to false new objects are wrapped with an EditableObject Wrapper, true will give out concreate object.
member.value: false if the ObjectView should generate wrapper.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.StarRowSupport
member.summary: Generate new objects with an IEditableObject wrapper

remarks.para: Some UI elements like the Binding Navigator or some 3rd party grids do not support the IEditableObject protocol. To get those UI elements working set this property to false.
Attention: false might lead to problems with grids having star rows.

member.value: If set to true new objects are wrapped with an IEditableObject wrapper; false will give out the unwrapped object.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.ReferencesAsCollections
member.summary: Provide all references as collections to the UI elements.

remarks.para: References can be presented as collections with 0 or 1 element. This makes it possible to have Master/Detail Views also with simple references.

member.value: If set to true references are presented as a collection to the UI elements. false will give out the normal reference.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains data about the control.
member.remarks: See for more information.
member.value: An object that contains data about the control. The default is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.PersistenceBehaviorValues
member.summary: Specification of the behavior while adding new or deleting objects from the ObjectView.
member.remarks: Lets you specify for example if adding a new line in a datagrid will add the object to the database and if deleting a row will remove the object from the database.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.PersistenceBehaviorValues.none
member.summary: Adding or Removing only affects the list but not the database.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.PersistenceBehaviorValues.markForAdd
member.summary: Added new objects will be marked for adding to the database.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.PersistenceBehaviorValues.markForDelete
member.summary: Removed objects will be marked for deletion from the database.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectView.PersistenceBehaviorValues.markForAddAndDelete
member.summary: Added new objects will be marked for adding and removed objects will be marked for deletion from the database.
